intro: Calopyxis malifolia, commonly known as the sweet-flower orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, are adapted for pollination by specific insect species.
